oai_dc:dc.dc:title: How to deal with adults with horns
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schleining, Jennifer A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine
sinus
horn
longhorn
trephination
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Conditions involving the horns of adult cattle requiring vet­erinary attention are not infrequent. Horns are desirable in certain breeds of cattle (i.e. Longhorns and some foundation genetics) and for cattle engaged in certain disciplines (i.e. ro­deo bulls). Broken horns, skull fractures at the base of the horn, sinusitis (with or without a history of surgical dehorning), and trauma are just some of the reasons horned cattle present to veterinarians. For each of these conditions, treatment tends to have a more favorable outcome when instituted early.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 59 (2025): 2025 Recent Graduate Conference Proceedings; 23-25
